channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree blocking visibility of parking rules sign, 1st March
item.description:
Hi I just pay £35 pound to your council because your signage is not visible so I could read and obey the parking rules due to this. I wonder if you can use my money to cut the tree in the picture. The downside is you will not be able to keep collecting money from drivers who cannot read the sign.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Carlton Street, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stockwell lane embankment of brook on LHS of road badly damaged, 1st March
item.description:
The embankment of the brook on the left hand side of Stockwell lane has recently been badly damaged by a vehicle near to the Apple Tree pub. The retaining wall blocks have been pushed into the brook . This area was damaged slightly a few months ago and Glos Highways have put cones in the area but not repaired it. The recent incident is far more serious and needs fixing soon .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Lane, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Standing water, 1st March
item.description:
Nearest property 141 Village Rd I’m told drains nearby were cleared, but not this one. Pedestrians get a soaking when vehicles go by!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 131, Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light confusion, 1st March
item.description:
The traffic lights at the roundabout on Tewkesbury Road where it meets Princess Elizabeth Way are causing confusion. Traffic going round the roundabout from Tewkesbury Rd into PEW often go through the lights when traffic exiting Cheltenham have a green signal. Equally traffic going straight on out of Cheltenham often go through the lights when traffic going round the roundabout have a green signal. I have inadvertently made both of these mistakes at different times, and have now seen other motors making those same mistakes. I'm not sure if this is because the traffic light post has been slightly rotated or the louvres on the traffic lights are ineffective but it is a serious situation just waiting for accidents to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 1st March
item.description:
email rcvd 01.03.24 - I hit a very deep pothole on Wednesday morning heading to the airport. It was on the connection road between Witcombe and Birdlip called Birdlip hill (not the A417) please see map enclosed with the exact location of the pothole, it is approx. 5 meters after the two cottages on the left hand side of the road ascending the hill.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 1st March
item.description:
on the drivers side and this is unavouldable pothole, on a narrow lane, this has punctured car wheel, ,the pothole is deep due to continual running water and this has deteriorated the road considerably

item.title: Pothole not fully fixed, 1st March
item.description:
Small patch has just been carried out (right of photo), but much larger holes have been missed (left). I’ve raised this issue multiple times, with only ever a small patch being done. Please fix the issue properly as the quick fixes surely cost the taxpayer more.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Whaddon Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
